meanings.definition: To hit more home runs than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, Sarah outhomered her friend in the baseball game.
meanings.sent2: The baseball player outhomered all his teammates during practice.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outhomered the other animals in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The sun outhomered the moon in brightness during the day.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah outhomered the other animals in speed during the race.

meanings.definition: To surpass in the number of home runs hit.
meanings.sent1: During the tournament, the team outhomered their opponents and won the championship.
meanings.sent2: He outhomered his own record by hitting five home runs in a single game.
meanings.sent3: The cat outhomered the dog in catching the flying frisbee.
meanings.sent4: The river outhomered the stream in the amount of water flowing through it.
meanings.sent5: The student outhomered the teacher in solving the math problem quickly.
